content.description: Two blocks are connected by a rope, as shown above. The masses of the blocks are <math alttext="5 kilograms" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the upper block and <math alttext="10 kilograms" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the lower block. An upward applied force of magnitude <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> acts on the upper block.
content.question: If <math alttext="F equals 300 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>300</mn><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>  </mtext><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, which of the following predictions about the acceleration of the two-block system is correct?

choices.label: The acceleration is downward with a magnitude of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The acceleration is downward with a magnitude of <math alttext="2 g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The acceleration is upward with a magnitude of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The acceleration is upward with a magnitude of <math alttext="2 g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The acceleration is upward with a magnitude of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
